    • Field Detail

      • buffer

        protected java.util.List<GString> buffer

        The rows of GStrings which make up this frame. Each GString represents a line in the buffer, where a line spans the width of the frame specified in the initial context when the terminal that this frame belongs to is constructed, or whenever this frame is resized.

        This buffer is a dynamic list so that the frame is readily adaptable when the frame is requested to resize; though characters added to the buffer outside of the current bounds will be ignored.

      • bounds

        protected Region bounds
        The region which spans from the origin (0, 0) in the upper-left corner to the maximum dimensions on the x- and y-axis. Components which attempt to place characters outside of these bounds will trigger an exception.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GlyphBuffer

        public GlyphBuffer()

    • Method Detail

      • update

        public void update(Glyph glyph,
                   Location location)
        Updates the character at the specified index. This will overwrite the character that occupied this location beforehand.
        Parameters:
        glyph - The glyph to insert.
        location - The location to place this glyph.

      • update

        public void update(Glyph glyph,
                   Location... locations)
        Updates the each of the Locations within this buffer so that they contain the given glyph.
        Parameters:
        glyph - The Glyph to insert into each of the given locations.
        locations - The Locations to insert the Glyph into.

      • update

        public void update(GString glyphs,
                   Location start)
        Starting at the given Location, this method will will replace the glyphs from start to the length of the string, assuming that this string is within the bounds of the buffer.
        Parameters:
        glyphs - The string to place in the buffer.
        start - The Location of the first glyph.

      • update

        public void update(GString[] lines,
                   Location start)
        For each GString in the array, this method updates the frame at the start location, starting at the given line and incrementing by one for each subsequent element in the array, and retaining the position for all lines added to the buffer.
        Parameters:
        lines - The strings to place in the frame.
        start - The location for the first character in the first line of the array.

      • getGlyph

        public Glyph getGlyph(Location location)
        Returns the glyph which occupies the given location.
        Parameters:
        location - The location in this buffer where the glyph is stored.
        Returns:
        The glyph in the given location.

      • getString

        public GString getString(int line)

      • getGlyphs

        public GString[] getGlyphs(Region region)
        Given a region, this method will return all glyphs within that region as an array of strings.
        Parameters:
        region - The region in which the glyphs are contained in.
        Returns:
        The glyphs in the given region as an array of GStrings, where each string in the array represents one line in the buffer from the start to the end position.

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Clear all characters out of this frame's buffer.

      • getBounds

        public Region getBounds()
